title: Feature request: show rustc_const_unstable in generated documentation

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-stability
labels.description: Area: issues related to #[stable] and #[unstable] attributes themselves.

labels.name: A-const-fn
labels.description: Area: const fn foo(..) {..}. Pure functions which can be applied at compile time.

labels.name: C-feature-request
labels.description: Category: A feature request, i.e: not implemented / a PR.

body:
<!-- Thanks for filing a 🙋 feature request 😄! -->

**Describe the problem you are trying to solve**
<!-- A clear and concise description of the problem this feature request is trying to solve. -->
I looked at [the documentation for `core::mem::variant_count`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/core/mem/fn.variant_count.html). It does mention that the function is nightly-only:

> 🔬 This is a nightly-only experimental API.  
(`variant_count` [#73662](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/73662))

It misleadingly doesn't mention that `const fn` can also be enabled on nightly, which requires opening [the `[src]` link](https://doc.rust-lang.org/src/core/mem/mod.rs.html#1038-1040) and noticing:

    #[rustc_const_unstable(feature = "variant_count", issue = "73662")]

**Describe the solution you'd like**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->

When the `rustc_const_unstable` attribute is applied to a function, show that, much like nightly-only functions are shown in the documentation.

<!-- **Notes** -->
<!-- Any additional context or information you feel may be relevant to the issue. -->
